Detailed Description

Get coordinates of one item.

This packet should be used when requesting the coordinates of an item with known ID. It is also possible to give an offset at the item to specify the coordinate more accurate.

After the normal header the request packet contains:
PosSizeComment
20 4 byte Nbr of items in packet
24 4 byte Flags
for each 4 byte item ID
2 byte offset

Definition at line 44 of file CoordinateOnItemPacket.h.

CoordinateOnItemRequestPacket::CoordinateOnItemRequestPacket (  uint32  packetID = 0,
uint32  reqID = 0,
bool  bboxWanted = false,
bool  allCoordinatesWanted = false
) 
 

Constructor.

Parameters:
packetID The packet ID.
reqID The request ID.
bboxWanted True if bounding boxes should be sent with the reply. It is somewhat processor consuming to calculate the bounding box, so don't use it if you don't have to.

uint32  offset = 0x7fff
) 
 

Add one item to the packet.

Parameters:
itemID The item ID.
offset The offset from node 0. If offset == MAX_UINT32 then the center will be used for closed polygons.

Return true if bounding boxes should be sent in the reply.

Otherwise non-valid bounding boxes are sent.

True if bounding boxes should be calculated.
